title: ICE canola firms on soybean strength
text:
ICE canola firms on soybean strength

Commodities 37 minutes ago (Oct 11, 2019 15:56)

© Reuters. ICE canola firms on soybean strength CHICAGO, Oct 11 (Reuters) - ICE (NYSE: ) Canada canola futures rose on Friday, following gains in the U.S. soybean market. * Benchmark November canola futures RSX9 settled up 40 cents at $459.90 per tonne. * The contract posted a weekly loss of 0.2%. * The contract found technical support at its 10-day moving average. * The November-January RSX9-F0 canola spread traded 11,981 times, closing at a $8.80 January premium. The January-March spread RSF0-H0 traded 1,834 times. * Chicago Board of Trade November soybeans SX9 rose 12-1/2 U.S. cents to US$9.36 a bushel. * The Canadian dollar strengthened to a four-week high against its U.S. counterpart on Friday after domestic data showing a much bigger-than-expected jobs gain in September supported bets for the Bank of Canada to keep interest rates on hold this month. CAD/

ICE canola firms on soybean strength
